org.fujion.plotly.layout

Class AngularAxisOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.plotly.layout.AxisOptions
        • org.fujion.plotly.layout.AngularAxisOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionMap.IOptionMapConverter, IClientTransform

    public class AngularAxisOptions
extends AxisOptions
    Layout options for polar angular axis.

    • Field Detail

      • direction

        @Option
public PolarDirectionEnum direction
        The direction corresponding to positive angles.

      • hoverformat

        @Option
public String hoverformat
        The hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. We add one item to d3's date formatter: "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46".

      • layer

        @Option
public LayerEnum layer
        The layer on which this axis is displayed.

        Default: ABOVE

      • period

        @Option
public Double period
        The angular period. Has an effect only when "angularaxis.type" is CATEGORY.

      • rotation

        @Option
public Integer rotation
        The start position (in degrees) of the angular axis By default, polar subplots with "direction" set to "counterclockwise" get a "rotation" of "0" which corresponds to due East (like what mathematicians prefer). In turn, polar with "direction" set to "clockwise" get a rotation of "90" which corresponds to due North (like on a compass),

      • thetaunit

        @Option
public PolarUnitsEnum thetaunit
        The format unit of the formatted "theta" values. Has an effect only when "angularaxis.type" is LINEAR.

        Default: DEGREES

      • tickcolor

        @Option
public String tickcolor
        The tick color.

        Default: "#444"

      • ticklen

        @Option
public Integer ticklen
        The tick length (in px).

        Default: 5

      • ticks

        @Option
public TicksEnum ticks
        Determines whether and where ticks are drawn.

      • tickwidth

        @Option
public Integer tickwidth
        The tick width (in px).

        Default: 1

      • visible

        @Option
public Boolean visible
        A single toggle to hide the axis while preserving interaction like dragging.

        Default: true when a cheater plot is present on the axis, otherwise false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AngularAxisOptions

        public AngularAxisOptions()
